definition: quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: They found themselves in a passive position under attack.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现自己处于被动挨打的局面。

sentences.english: Past participles (- ed form) for adjectives of passive or completed actions.
sentences.chinese: 过去分词表达完成或被动感觉的形容词。

sentences.english: So apparently the passivity the inertia can be explained.
sentences.chinese: 这么一来惯性的被动状态就能说得通了。

sentences.english: Fifth, the paper studies TRM passive localization with vector hydrophone.
sentences.chinese: 第五，矢量水听器时间反转镜被动定位技术研究。

sentences.english: Diabase-porphyrite was the splitting product of passive margin of Gondwana Continent in Late Jurassic.
sentences.chinese: 辉绿玢岩是冈瓦纳被动陆缘在晚古生代裂解的产物。

sentences.english: The motion is detected by 32 active and passive near-infrared sensors.
sentences.chinese: 该议案是由32个检测主动和被动的近红外传感器。

sentences.english: We should translate this sentence in passive voice.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该用被动语态翻译这个句子。

sentences.english: These should also be assessed passively, while holding the joint and feeling for crepitus.
sentences.chinese: 这些也应该被动评估，同时握住关节和感觉摩擦感。

sentences.english: One passive method of control is to plant the tree in a large aviary wire basket.
sentences.chinese: 其中被动控制方法，是植物树在一大片观鸟丝篮。

sentences.english: From this, the optimum structure was obtained. The calculated results provide the basis for the designing and using of passive ejectors.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果可以为被动式引射器的设计与使用提供依据。

sentences.english: They are never active to do anything; they are just passive to pave road and build bridge for their members.
sentences.chinese: 他们从不主动做任何事，只是被动地为成员铺路架桥。

sentences.english: Second there is the weak passive defense reaction.
sentences.chinese: 第一种是，强力被动防御反应。

sentences.english: Some passive markers are not followed by the agent.
sentences.chinese: 少数被动标记后不出现施事。

sentences.english: Youare making yourself more passive, unreflective, person, the more TV youwatch.
sentences.chinese: 看得电视越多，你就越将自己变成被动，粗心的人。

sentences.english: The result is a production-line approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 结果便对教育采取一种被动应付的态度。

sentences.english: I tend to dwell more on the negative and my worries.
sentences.chinese: 我倾向于沉浸在被动否定的情绪和自己的麻烦事中。

definition: to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
to rely on sth (for support etc)/to depend on
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
